jobDescription: Data Scientist II – Customer Intelligence focuses on extracting, understanding, manipulating and conveying complex data from MINDBODY’s production environment. This position works closely with their manager to prioritize tasks that are important to supporting our product and business units.  The Customer Intelligence (CI) branch of MINDBODY’s Data Science department is responsible for delivering customer insights around product usage and customer lifecycle to stakeholders across the business. This team leverages both product and business systems data to provide a deeper understanding of customer engagement with MINDBODY and its platform, supporting key functions and initiatives within Product Development, Business Development, Customer Experience/Success, Marketing and Sales.  MINDBODY’s Data Science department makes sense of our data world through meaningful and actionable insights, identifying trends, delivering reports, informing product and infrastructure advancements, and promoting a culture of data-driven decision making. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor’s degree, quantitative field preferred3-5 years of experience performing quantitative data analysisIntermediate proficiency in MS SQL, SSIS, Excel, Access, Tableau, Salesforce, R, Python, Amazon RedShift, MS AzureExperience quantifying and prioritizing projects that require heavy data analysisAptitude for numbers and a curiosity about information and dataAbility to present data in a simple, clean, concise visual and written mannerStrong attention to detail, analytical mindset, and highly organizedDesire to work in a fast paced, potentially ambiguous, start-up-like atmosphereStrong technical aptitude and demonstrated ability to quickly evaluate and learn new technologiesStrong interpersonal skills, with the ability to work independently and within a team environmentPRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Partner with Prod Dev, Customer Experience and Marketing teams to determine analytical needs, gather requirements and deliver necessary reports and analysesWrite SQL queries to run on data warehouse and production databases to fulfill ad-hoc data requestsAnalyze extracted data, review for accuracy and look for trendsProvide insights and analyses around product and customer dataParticipate in the SQL code review process, particularly reviewing level I coding workDevelop new scripts, KPIs and dashboards as neededInform Prod Dev on decisions around usage tracking, data creation and storage, as well as product usage trendsApply advanced tools and methods to analyze product data and derive meaningful, actionable insights to Prod Dev and the rest of the businessServe as subject matter experts (SMEs) in the area of product usage and data schemas, for the benefit of other analysts as well as PT&E;Attain a high degree of knowledge about MINDBODY’s data infrastructureConsult with management to understand current and future business goals and strategies, and ensure that high-visibility reporting and analysis is alignedAll other duties as assigned
